Generation II.Gold: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.
Generation II.Silver: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.
Generation II.Crystal: The color of the mysterious fluid secreted from its tail is predetermined for each Smeargle .
Generation II.Stadium 2: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Smeargle marks the boundaries of its territory using a body fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. Over 5,000 different marks left by this Pok é mon have been found.
Generation III.Sapphire: Smeargle marks the boundaries of its territory using a body fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. Over 5,000 different marks left by this Pok é mon have been found.
Generation III.Emerald: A Smeargle marks its territory using a fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. About 5,000 different marks left by this Pok é mon have been found.
Generation III.FireRed: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.
Generation III.LeafGreen: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.

Generation IV.Diamond: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.
Generation IV.Pearl: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.
Generation IV.Platinum: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.
Generation IV.HeartGold: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.

Generation V.Black: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.
Generation V.White: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.
Generation V.Black 2: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.
Generation V.White 2: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.

Generation VI.X: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.
Generation VI.Y: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Smeargle marks the boundaries of its territory using a body fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. Over 5,000 different marks left by this Pokémon have been found.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Smeargle marks the boundaries of its territory using a body fluid that leaks out from the tip of its tail. Over 5,000 different marks left by this Pokémon have been found.

Generation VII.Sun: The unique creations produced by each Smeargle are painted using the fluid that oozes from its tail. This is how it marks its territory.
Generation VII.Moon: It draws symbols all over the place to mark its territory. In towns with many Smeargle, the walls are covered in graffiti.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: The fluid of Smeargle's tail secretions changes in the intensity of its hue as the Pokémon's emotions change.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Once a Smeargle reaches adulthood, it will have other members of its species leave paw prints on its back.
Generation IX.Violet: The color of the mysterious fluid secreted from the tip of the tail is predetermined for each Smeargle.

Generation IV.HeartGold: Ruins of Alph Safari Zone Morning Day (Plains, default, and with 3 Forest points)
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Ruins of Alph Safari Zone Morning Day (Plains, default, and with 3 Forest points)

Generation V.Dream World: Pokémon Café Forest and Spooky Manor

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Savanna Biome , Coastal Biome , Torchlit Labyrinth , Canyon Biome , Chargestone Cavern , Polar Biome
